bayou.websocket

Class WebSocketResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.websocket.WebSocketResponse
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WebSocketResponse.Accept, WebSocketResponse.Reject

    public class WebSocketResponse
extends Object
    WebSocket handshake response.

    A handshake response is either a WebSocketResponse.Reject or an WebSocketResponse.Accept.

    See WebSocketHandler.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class WebSocketResponse.Reject
      To reject the handshake.
      static class WebSocketResponse.Accept
      To accept the handshake.

    • Method Summary

      Static Methods
      WebSocketResponse.Reject reject(int statusCode, String msg)
      Create a Reject response.
      WebSocketResponse.Accept accept(FunctionX<WebSocketChannel,Async<?>> channelHandler)
      Create an Accept response.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • reject

        public static WebSocketResponse.Reject reject(int statusCode,
                                              String msg)
        Create a Reject response.

        This method is equivalent to 

             new WebSocketResponse.Reject( HttpResponse.text(statusCode, msg) )

      • accept

        public static WebSocketResponse.Accept accept(FunctionX<WebSocketChannel,Async<?>> channelHandler)
        Create an Accept response.

        This method is equivalent to 

             new WebSocketResponse.Accept(null, channelHandler);
